intro: Manihot digitata, commonly known as arrowleaf manioc, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters, characterized by its palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Its roots are the primary economically important part, used in the production of cassava flour and other starch-based products. The plant is also valued for its adaptability to various soil types and its role in traditional agriculture.
